optionalfeature.name: Arcing Storm
entries: You can cast the {@spell lightning lure|tce} and {@spell shocking grasp} cantrips, with Charisma being your spellcasting ability for them. When you cast either spell as an action on your turn, you can immediately cast it again as part of the same action against a different creature within 10 feet of the initial target, ignoring the range of each spell when cast as the second part of this feature.

optionalfeature.name: Disciple of the Storm
entries: You've studied the ways of the storm. You can tell when an area has been ravaged by a storm, and can also sense when a nonmagical storm will arrive in an area that you're in, up to 24 hours before the storm hits.

Additionally, you ignore the creature size restriction of {@spell gust|xge}, and can cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Strikes Twice
entries: When the blast of lightning strikes down as part of your Sky Splitter feature, you can have it mark the spot again, which continues to spark with energy. At the start of your next turn, another lightning bolt strikes down, and hostile creatures inside the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, creatures take {@dice 4d12} lightning damage, or half as much on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Storm's Vengeance
entries: When you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can mark them with the fury of the storm, which lasts for 1 minute. When you hit a marked creature with a pact weapon, they take an additional {@dice 1d12} lightning damage from the attack, you can push them up to 10 feet in a horizontal direction of your choice, and you the mark is removed. If the attack that removed the mark was a melee weapon attack, you can push the creature an additional 10 feet.
You have a number of uses of this mark equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and regain all uses  when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Updraft
entries: You're always under the effects of the {@spell feather fall} spell while you aren't wearing heavy armour and aren't unconscious or incapacitated. You can end this effect or activate it on your turn (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Wind Spirit
entries: When you summon your familiar, you can have it appear as a wind spirit. Your familiar has the statistics of a blood hawk (found on page 319 of the Monster Manual) except it is an elemental, rather than a celestial, fey, or fiend.

While the spirit is perched on your shoulder, your movement speed increases by 10 feet and you gain a bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) score and to Wisdom (Perception) checks. The bonus equals your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Relentless Storm lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Sky Splitter
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can call down a bolt of lightning to both empower you and strike back your foes. As a bonus action on your turn, you choose a point you can see within 60 feet of you, which begins to spark with energy. At the start of your next turn, a blast of lightning strikes down, causing a 10-foot radius sphere to erupt centred on the point. Hostile creatures inside the sphere must make a Strength saving throw against your warlock spell save DC, being pushed 10 feet directly away from the centre of the sphere on a failed save. Additionally, hostile creatures that are inside the sphere when the lightning strikes can't take reactions until the start of your next turn.

If you're inside the sphere when the lightning strikes, your patron's strength shields you. You gain temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d12} + your Charisma modifier + half your warlock level. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute.
The radius of the sphere increases as you gain levels in this class; becoming a 15-foot radius sphere at 5th level, and a 20-foot radius sphere at 9th level.
Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Storm's Blessings
entries: Also at 1st level, your patron grants you minor boons. You learn the {@spell gust} cantrip, and can speak, read, and write Auran. You're also naturally adapted to strong wind and heavy precipitation, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

subclassFeature.name: Lightning Reflexes
entries: At 6th level, you can move with quick bursts of agility when in danger. When you would be subjected to an effect that targets an area, you can use your reaction to move up to half your speed. If at the end of the movement you are outside of the targeted area, you are unaffected by the triggering effect.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rolling Thunder
entries: At 10th level, the power of the storm guides your steps, allowing you to stand firm against the world. You can't suffer disadvantage on Strength or Dexterity checks or saving throws while you're not unconscious or incapacitated. Additionally, you gain resistance to lightning and thunder damage.

subclassFeature.name: Thundercrash
entries: At 14th level, you fully embrace the storm. As an action on your turn, you can launch into the air, vanishing from sight. At the start of your next turn, you can crash down on an empty space within 500 feet of your original location. Hostile creatures within 20 feet of the space you land must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d12} lightning damage and {@dice 3d12} thunder damage and is knocked prone on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked prone on a success. Creatures within 1 mile of the space you land can hear the impact as it reverberates out.
A nonmagical object or structure that isn't being worn or carried takes twice as much damage if it's in the area.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
